We’re in a new economic era, which is defying many of the core principles of traditional economic theory. 

That’s why today’s hearing is an opportunity to learn more about the different perspectives driving the debate about the economic costs of debt.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: By investing strategically in responsible policies that reflect our nation’s values -- and by having a more sober and evidenced-based understanding of the costs of debt -- we can lay the groundwork for a productive and dynamic 21st century economy.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: The Republicans’ 2017 tax law is the poster child for wasteful deficit-financed policy: It has failed to provide any meaningful boost to the economy but increased our debt by $1.9 trillion and counting, worsening our already serious revenue problem.

.@RepJohnYarmuth: Deficits – and what they’re used for – matter… Policies that support working Americans in an economic downturn, invest in our families, communities, and environment, and have a positive impact on our long-term fiscal health are responsible uses of deficits

.@RepJohnYarmuth: persistently low interest rates have made reducing deficits in the near-term less urgent – even counterproductive given the risk to economic growth. It has also increased Congress’s fiscal space, empowering lawmakers to make responsible investments

.@RepJohnYarmuth: Today’s economy defies many aspects of traditional economic theory… we’ve seen interest rates & inflation fall to record lows while debt has soared to its highest level since just after World War II. We are truly in a new [economic] era

Deferral: A deferral is withholding or delaying funds from being used. Under the ICA the President can defer funds for 3 specific reasons - NONE of which are policy reasons:  https://bit.ly/2qnbJQi  pic.twitter.com/vIwBI0R47E

Rescission: A rescission involves the cancellation of funds previously appropriated by Congress. If the President wants to spend less 💵 than Congress provided for a particular purpose, Congress must first pass a law to *rescind* the funding:  https://bit.ly/2qnbJQi  pic.twitter.com/s81cTMbtW6

Impoundment is divided into two categories:
✔️Rescissions
✔️Deferrals  https://bit.ly/2qnbJQi  pic.twitter.com/c8dhCh5yUc

The ICA established procedures the president must follow to reduce, delay or eliminate funding.

This prohibits the President from refusing to release Congressionally appropriated funds just because they don't like it:  https://bit.ly/2qnbJQi  pic.twitter.com/nv1ZZmu3Hn

For those still asking "why" the President can't withhold whatever funds he wants, here's your guide to the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 (ICA) -- as explained by gifs ⬇️⬇️  https://bit.ly/2qnbJQi  pic.twitter.com/IVVYeYCiHH
